name: 01- Project Overview
content:
Healthcare-Diabetes-Prediction


Objective:

To develop a Random Forest Classification model that accurately predicts diabetes risk based on physiological and demographic factors.

The aim is to support early detection and preventive healthcare interventions, enabling better management of diabetes through timely diagnosis and evidence-based decision making.


Approach

1. Data Preparation & EDA

  • Dataset Features:
  • Pregnancies history
  • Glucose concentration
  • Blood pressure measurements
  • Skin thickness values
  • Insulin levels
  • Body Mass Index (BMI)
  • Diabetes Pedigree Function (genetic influence)
  • Age of patients
  • Outcome (target variable – diabetes presence)
  • Steps:
  • Handle missing values, duplicates, and inconsistencies.
  • Normalize/standardize numerical features if required.
  • Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to understand distributions, correlations, and patterns.


2. Model Training (Random Forest Classifier)

  • Train a Random Forest classifier using input health indicators.
  • Tune hyperparameters: number of trees, maximum depth, and feature selection strategy.
  • Exploit Random Forest’s strengths:
  • Captures non-linear feature interactions.
  • Handles missing data effectively.
  • Provides feature importance rankings for interpretability.


3. Model Evaluation

  • Metrics: Accuracy, Precision, Recall, F1-score.
  • Confusion Matrix: Analyze true positives/negatives and false positives/negatives.
  • Cross-Validation (k-fold): Ensure stable performance across multiple splits.
  • ROC-AUC Curve: Measure model’s ability to distinguish between diabetic and non-diabetic patients.


Significance

  • Enables proactive diabetes risk assessment using a robust ensemble learning algorithm.
  • Provides quantitative risk insights for healthcare providers.
  • Contributes to public health efforts by facilitating preventive strategies and early intervention.


Expected Outcomes

  • An accurate Random Forest model for reliable diabetes risk prediction.
  • Feature importance rankings to highlight key risk factors.
  • A scalable solution ready for integration into healthcare systems for automated, real-time risk assessment.
